column4: Hi all - anybody willing to help an ubuntu newbie with a window manager problem?

Here's the deal.  I want to use sawfish instead of metacity.  I went into the gconf tool and changed the window manager setting, but it keeps getting reverted back to metacity when I log in.  I do have sawfish installed...
Any thoughts?
make sure you save your session on logout if using sawfish
I can't get sawfish to fire up in the first place...
in a terminal: killall metacity && sleep 2 && sawfish &
if sawfish runs and the gconf key is set, save your session on logout
Let me give that a shot.
on logout
Looks like metacity is getting respawned automagically when I try to kill it.  8)
then drop the sleep command in the line i gave you
dont forget to check the checkbox ;)
That seems to have done it.  Thanks for the suggestions.
once sawfish had a config tool
sawfish-ui?
cant you switch it off with that ?
I didn't see an option in there ... I'll look again though.
The sawfish-ui thing doesn't seem to have an option to turn the pager off.  Any other thoughts?  8)
dunno, i could only point you to google, last time i used sawfish was gnome 1.x
*grin*  Thanks for the help anyway.  Do you use gnome?  If so, are you using metacity?
sure, i use ubuntu default (with calendar ;) )
